nl: Let $p$ and $q$ be distinct odd primes such that $p-1$ divides $q-1$. If $(n, p q)=1$, show that $n^{q-1} \equiv 1(p q)$.
lean:
∀ {p q n : ℕ} (hp0 : p.Prime ∧ p > 2)
  (hq0 : q.Prime ∧ q > 2) (hpq0 : p ≠ q) (hpq1 : p - 1 ∣ q - 1)
  (hn : n.gcd (p*q) = 1), n^(q-1) ≡ 1 [MOD p*q]
candidate: ∀ {p q : ℕ} (hp : Nat.Prime p) (hq : Nat.Prime q) (h : p ≠ q) (hp' : p % 4 = 1) (hq' : q % 4 = 1) (hpq : p - 1 ∣ q - 1), p * q ∣ q - 1
imports:
import Mathlib

open Real
open scoped BigOperators
